ids_info.name: nbi
ids_info.description: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus

nbi/unit.documentation: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus.

nbi/unit/name.documentation: Short string identifier (unique for a given device). Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually.

nbi/unit/description.documentation: Description, e.g. “channel viewing the upper divertor”. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually.

nbi/unit/species.documentation: Injected species. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually.

nbi/unit/species/a.documentation: Mass of atom. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within species container: Injected species.

nbi/unit/species/z_n.documentation: Nuclear charge. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within species container: Injected species.

nbi/unit/species/name.documentation: String identifying the species (e.g. H, D, T, ...). Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within species container: Injected species.

nbi/unit/power_launched.documentation: Power launched from this unit into the vacuum vessel. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually.

nbi/unit/power_launched/data.documentation: Data. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within power_launched container: Power launched from this unit into the vacuum vessel.

nbi/unit/power_launched/time.documentation: Time. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within power_launched container: Power launched from this unit into the vacuum vessel.

nbi/unit/energy.documentation: Full energy of the injected species (acceleration of a single atom). Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually.

nbi/unit/energy/data.documentation: Data. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within energy container: Full energy of the injected species (acceleration of a single atom).

Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within energy container: Full energy of the injected species (acceleration of a single atom).

nbi/unit/beam_current_fraction.documentation: Fractions of beam current distributed among the different energies, the first index corresponds to the fast neutrals energy (1:full, 2: half, 3: one third). Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually.

nbi/unit/beam_current_fraction/data.documentation: Data. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beam_current_fraction container: Fractions of beam current distributed among the different energies, the first index corresponds to the fast neutrals energy (1:full, 2: half, 3: one third).

nbi/unit/beam_current_fraction/time.documentation: Time. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beam_current_fraction container: Fractions of beam current distributed among the different energies, the first index corresponds to the fast neutrals energy (1:full, 2: half, 3: one third).

nbi/unit/beam_power_fraction.documentation: Fractions of beam power distributed among the different energies, the first index corresponds to the fast neutrals energy (1:full, 2: half, 3: one third). Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually.

nbi/unit/beam_power_fraction/data.documentation: Data. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beam_power_fraction container: Fractions of beam power distributed among the different energies, the first index corresponds to the fast neutrals energy (1:full, 2: half, 3: one third).

nbi/unit/beam_power_fraction/time.documentation: Time. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beam_power_fraction container: Fractions of beam power distributed among the different energies, the first index corresponds to the fast neutrals energy (1:full, 2: half, 3: one third).

nbi/unit/beamlets_group.documentation: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually.

nbi/unit/beamlets_group/position.documentation: R, Z, Phi position of the beamlet group centre. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian.

nbi/unit/beamlets_group/position/r.documentation: Major radius. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian. Within position container: R, Z, Phi position of the beamlet group centre.

nbi/unit/beamlets_group/position/phi.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above). Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian. Within position container: R, Z, Phi position of the beamlet group centre.

nbi/unit/beamlets_group/position/z.documentation: Height. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian. Within position container: R, Z, Phi position of the beamlet group centre.

nbi/unit/beamlets_group/tangency_radius.documentation: Tangency radius (major radius where the central line of a NBI unit is tangent to a circle around the torus). Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian.

nbi/unit/beamlets_group/angle.documentation: Angle of inclination between a beamlet at the centre of the injection unit surface and the horiontal plane. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian.

nbi/unit/beamlets_group/tilting.documentation: In case of dynamic beam tilting (i.e. during the pulse), e.g. for some Beam Emission Spectroscopy use cases, variations of position, tangency radius and angle with respect to their static value, for various time slices. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian.

nbi/unit/beamlets_group/tilting/delta_po.documentation: Variation of the position of the beamlet group centre. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian. Within tilting container: In case of dynamic beam tilting (i.e. during the pulse), e.g. for some Beam Emission Spectroscopy use cases, variations of position, tangency radius and angle with respect to their static value, for various time slices.

Major radius. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within tilting container: In case of dynamic beam tilting (i.e. during the pulse), e.g. for some Beam Emission Spectroscopy use cases, variations of position, tangency radius and angle with respect to their static value, for various time slices. Within delta_position container: Variation of the position of the beamlet group centre.

Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above). Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within delta_position container: Variation of the position of the beamlet group centre.

Height. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian. Within tilting container: In case of dynamic beam tilting (i.e. during the pulse), e.g. for some Beam Emission Spectroscopy use cases, variations of position, tangency radius and angle with respect to their static value, for various time slices. Within delta_position container: Variation of the position of the beamlet group centre.

nbi/unit/beamlets_group/tilting/delta_ta.documentation: Variation of the tangency radius (major radius where the central line of a NBI unit is tangent to a circle around the torus). Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian. Within tilting container: In case of dynamic beam tilting (i.e. during the pulse), e.g. for some Beam Emission Spectroscopy use cases, variations of position, tangency radius and angle with respect to their static value, for various time slices.

nbi/unit/beamlets_group/tilting/delta_an.documentation: Variation of the angle of inclination between a beamlet at the centre of the injection unit surface and the horiontal plane. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian. Within tilting container: In case of dynamic beam tilting (i.e. during the pulse), e.g. for some Beam Emission Spectroscopy use cases, variations of position, tangency radius and angle with respect to their static value, for various time slices.

nbi/unit/beamlets_group/tilting/time.documentation: Time. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian. Within tilting container: In case of dynamic beam tilting (i.e. during the pulse), e.g. for some Beam Emission Spectroscopy use cases, variations of position, tangency radius and angle with respect to their static value, for various time slices.

nbi/unit/beamlets_group/direction.documentation: Direction of the beam seen from above the torus: -1 = clockwise; 1 = counter clockwise. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian.

nbi/unit/beamlets_group/width_horizontal.documentation: Horizontal width (dimensions of the smallest rectangle that surrounds the outer dimensions of the beamlets) of the beamlet group at the injection unit surface (or grounded grid). Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian.

nbi/unit/beamlets_group/width_vertical.documentation: Vertical width (dimensions of the smallest rectangle that surrounds the outer dimensions of the beamlets) of the beamlet group at the injection unit surface (or grounded grid). Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian.

nbi/unit/beamlets_group/focus.documentation: Describes how the beamlet group is focused. Calculations of width_min_horizontal and width_min_vertical are on a plane defined by the average normal vector of the two constituent accelerator nbi target planes. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian.

nbi/unit/beamlets_group/focus/focal_leng.documentation: Horizontal focal length along the beam line, i.e. the point along the centre of the beamlet-group where the beamlet-group has its minimum horizontal width. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian. Within focus container: Describes how the beamlet group is focused. Calculations of width_min_horizontal and width_min_vertical are on a plane defined by the average normal vector of the two constituent accelerator nbi target planes.

Vertical focal length along the beam line, i.e. the point along the centre of the beamlet-group where the beamlet-group has its minimum vertical width. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian. Within focus container: Describes how the beamlet group is focused. Calculations of width_min_horizontal and width_min_vertical are on a plane defined by the average normal vector of the two constituent accelerator nbi target planes.

nbi/unit/beamlets_group/focus/width_min_.documentation: The horizontal width (Full Width at Half Maximum) of the beamlets group at the horizontal focal point. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian. Within focus container: Describes how the beamlet group is focused. Calculations of width_min_horizontal and width_min_vertical are on a plane defined by the average normal vector of the two constituent accelerator nbi target planes.

The vertical width (Full Width at Half Maximum) of the beamlets group at the vertical focal point. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian. Within focus container: Describes how the beamlet group is focused. Calculations of width_min_horizontal and width_min_vertical are on a plane defined by the average normal vector of the two constituent accelerator nbi target planes.

nbi/unit/beamlets_group/divergence_compo.documentation: Detailed information on beamlet divergence. Divergence is described as a superposition of Gaussian components with amplitide "particles_fraction" and vertical/horizontal divergence. Note that for positive ion NBI the divergence is well described by a single Gaussian. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian.

Fraction of injected particles in the component. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian. Within divergence_component container: Detailed information on beamlet divergence. Divergence is described as a superposition of Gaussian components with amplitide "particles_fraction" and vertical/horizontal divergence. Note that for positive ion NBI the divergence is well described by a single Gaussian.

The vertical beamlet divergence of the component. Here the divergence is defined for Gaussian beams as the angel where the beam density is reduced by a factor 1/e compared to the maximum density. For non-Gaussian beams the divergence is sqrt(2)*mean((x-mean(x))**2), where x is the angle and the mean should be performed over the beam density, P(x): mean(y)=int(y*P(x)*dx). Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian. Within divergence_component container: Detailed information on beamlet divergence. Divergence is described as a superposition of Gaussian components with amplitide "particles_fraction" and vertical/horizontal divergence. Note that for positive ion NBI the divergence is well described by a single Gaussian.

The horiztonal beamlet divergence of the component. Here the divergence is defined for Gaussian beams as the angel where the beam density is reduced by a factor 1/e compared to the maximum density. For non-Gaussian beams the divergence is sqrt(2)*mean((x-mean(x))**2), where x is the angle and the mean should be performed over the beam density, P(x): mean(y)=int(y*P(x)*dx). Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian. Within divergence_component container: Detailed information on beamlet divergence. Divergence is described as a superposition of Gaussian components with amplitide "particles_fraction" and vertical/horizontal divergence. Note that for positive ion NBI the divergence is well described by a single Gaussian.

Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian. Within beamlets container: Detailed information on beamlets. Within positions container: Position of each beamlet.

nbi/unit/beamlets_group/beamlets/tangenc.documentation: Tangency radius (major radius where the central line of a beamlet is tangent to a circle around the torus), for each beamlet. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian. Within beamlets container: Detailed information on beamlets.

nbi/unit/beamlets_group/beamlets/angles.documentation: Angle of inclination between a line at the centre of a beamlet and the horizontal plane, for each beamlet. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian. Within beamlets container: Detailed information on beamlets.

nbi/unit/beamlets_group/beamlets/power_f.documentation: Fraction of power of a unit injected by each beamlet. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within beamlets_group container: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlets group provides a fair description. Beamlet groups are assumed to be Gaussian. Within beamlets container: Detailed information on beamlets.

nbi/unit/source.documentation: Description of the surface of the ion source from which the beam is extracted. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually.

nbi/unit/source/geometry_type.documentation: Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular', 3:'rectangle'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. Note that there is some flexibility here and the data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the object, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.  In case of 'rectangle', the surface is a rectangle defined by its centre, widths in the X1 and X2 directions, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within source container: Description of the surface of the ion source from which the beam is extracted.

nbi/unit/source/centre.documentation: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within source container: Description of the surface of the ion source from which the beam is extracted.

nbi/unit/source/centre/r.documentation: Major radius. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within source container: Description of the surface of the ion source from which the beam is extracted. Within centre container: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

nbi/unit/source/centre/phi.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above). Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within source container: Description of the surface of the ion source from which the beam is extracted. Within centre container: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

nbi/unit/source/centre/z.documentation: Height. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within source container: Description of the surface of the ion source from which the beam is extracted. Within centre container: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

nbi/unit/source/radius.documentation: Radius of the circle, used only if geometry_type = 2. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within source container: Description of the surface of the ion source from which the beam is extracted.

nbi/unit/source/x1_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above). Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within source container: Description of the surface of the ion source from which the beam is extracted.

nbi/unit/source/x2_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. nbi/unit/source/x2_unit_vector/z.documentation: Component along Z axis. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within source container: Description of the surface of the ion source from which the beam is extracted. Within x2_unit_vector container: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.

nbi/unit/source/x3_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. nbi/unit/source/x1_width.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X1 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3. nbi/unit/source/outline.documentation: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system. Repeat the first point since this is a closed contour. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within source container: Description of the surface of the ion source from which the beam is extracted.

nbi/unit/source/surface.documentation: Surface of the detector/aperture, derived from the above geometric data. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within aperture container: Description of a set of collimating apertures through which the beam is launched. Within outline container: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system. Repeat the first point since this is a closed contour.

nbi/unit/aperture/surface.documentation: Surface of the detector/aperture, derived from the above geometric data. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus. Within unit container: The NBI system is described as a set of units of which the power can be controlled individually. Within aperture container: Description of a set of collimating apertures through which the beam is launched.

nbi/latency.documentation: Upper bound of the delay between input command received from the RT network and actuator starting to react. Applies globally to the system described by this IDS unless specific latencies (e.g. channel-specific or antenna-specific) are provided at a deeper level in the IDS structure. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus.

nbi/time.documentation: Generic time. Within nbi IDS: Neutral Beam Injection systems and description of the fast neutrals that arrive into the torus.
